conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: extruded walls with thickness, visible top/side faces, perceivable room volumes, and an angled/isometric viewpoint with ceiling/roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor softness/ambiguity on some wall edges and opening details reduces perfect geometric crispness.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room arrangement matches (living/dining/kitchen top, bedrooms bottom left/right, bath core). Some discrepancies in exact partition lengths/door placements and a few opening positions/sizes appear approximated vs the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present and generally assigned to correct rooms (sofas/coffee table/rug, dining table, beds, kitchen counters, bath fixtures). A few items look simplified and not perfectly aligned to the 2D furniture orientation.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable structure with consistent materials and clean background; lighting supports visibility. Some areas (door swings/openings and certain window details) are slightly hard to verify precisely due to simplified modeling.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout distortion: some wall/partition lengths and offsets do not perfectly match the 2D proportions (notably around the central hall/bath/closet transitions).
Door/window fidelity issues: several openings appear simplified, with door swing/placement and some window/door sizes not fully consistent with the 2D plan.

summary: A true and clean 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, but with some minor-to-moderate mismatches in exact partition proportions and opening placements compared to the 2D plan.
